result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica J Bahr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Kmart to be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before costs and fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.  Any terms deemed appropriate by the Agent.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Commencing forthwith.
Consecutive to: Present sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  Follwo through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs previously ordered to be paid as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessica J Bahr in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

3 YEARS 1 MONTH IMPRISONMENT consecutive to present sentence, commencing forthwith. 
  -  1 YEAR 1 MONTH OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  

*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

*Previous ordered costs to be converted to be paid as a condition of probation. 

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Sentencing Memorandum filed by Attorney Ehrfurth.
**Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 7/5/17.**

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Plea and Sentencing 5/4/16
**Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 6/28/17.**
